str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
Of Hebrew origin; Judas, the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region.
Silas, a pet-form of the name Silvanus; a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul. Contraction for Silouanos; Silas, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
